title: Will South Korea's faltering economy make it the new Japan?
text:
After campaigning on promises of a fairer society in which the disadvantaged would have more, jobs would be abundant and the all-powerful “chaebol” conglomerates would be brought to heel, Moon Jae-in was elected president of South Korea in May 2017.

Such was his popularity with the public – tired of political and corporate scandals and an economy apparently in gradual but irreversible decline – his support rate was above 80pc in his first months in office as he forged ahead with an agenda that was little short of revolutionary.
